question:
Find the value of x to the nearest tenth: Lx = (d/dx * (A * x-squared)) + 4-thousand'n'ninety-7 minus C
Where L is the last two digits of the year of the Venezuelan Declaration of Independence,
A is the number of colors in the TikTok logo as of July 2023, excluding black and white,
and C is the height of the average woman in the Philippines according to a July 2023 Business Insider article, rounded to the nearest whole centimeter

   Summary: This graphic ranks the 20 shortest countries in the world, by average height. Data comes from NCD Risk Factor Collaboration, compiled by Business Insider.
   Content: Home Explore Library Support Nov 9, 2024 Mapped: The 20 Shortest Countries in the World 🌱 Follow What we’re showing This graphic ranks the 20 shortest countries in the world, by average height. Data comes from NCD Risk Factor Collaboration , compiled by Business Insider . Note that rankings are based on average person height (men and women combined). For context, the global average height of a human is 5' 4". Why are these countries shorter than average? Here’s a high level analysis of why certain countries are shorter than others: Genetics: Many of the shortest countries are found in Southeast Asia, Latin America, and Sub-Saharan Africa. These populations may be predisposed to smaller body frames. Nutrition: Nutrition during early childhood can have a significant impact on growth, meaning countries that struggle with food insecurity may see shorter heights. Socioeconomic factors: Poverty can affect living conditions and access to food & healthcare. For instance, many of the world’s shortest countries are lower-income nations. Using medical data, Insider calculated average height figures for the 25 shortest countries. Scroll down to see the nations with the shortest people on earth. A tape measure. Shutterstock Worldwide, scientists have found that there's around a 20 centimeter, or 7.8 inch, difference between the average height of a child in the tallest and shortest countries, according to the BBC . When it comes to adults, in countries like the Netherlands — ranked as the tallest on earth — the average person towers as high as 175.62cm (5 feet 7.96 inches). But at the other end of the scale, the average height is considerably lower. trajectory.actor_reasoning:
- L = 11 (Venezuelan Declaration of Independence in 1811 → last two digits 11)
- A = 2 (TikTok brand colors excluding black and white: cyan and pink/red)
- C = 150 (Business Insider July 2023 lists Filipino women at 149.6 cm → rounds to 150)
- Equation: Lx = d/dx(Ax^2) + 4097 − C → 11x = 2A x + 4097 − 150 → 11x = 4x + 3947 → 7x = 3947 → x = 3947/7 ≈ 563.9

FINAL ANSWER: 563.9

   Content: Home Explore Library Support Nov 9, 2024 Mapped: The 20 Shortest Countries in the World 🌱 Follow What we’re showing This graphic ranks the 20 shortest countries in the world, by average height. Data comes from NCD Risk Factor Collaboration , compiled by Business Insider . Note that rankings are based on average person height (men and women combined). For context, the global average height of a human is 5' 4". Why are these countries shorter than average? Here’s a high level analysis of why certain countries are shorter than others: Genetics: Many of the shortest countries are found in Southeast Asia, Latin America, and Sub-Saharan Africa. These populations may be predisposed to smaller body frames. Nutrition: Nutrition during early childhood can have a significant impact on growth, meaning countries that struggle with food insecurity may see shorter heights. Socioeconomic factors: Poverty can affect living conditions and access to food & healthcare. For instance, many of the world’s shortest countries are lower-income nations.                 subscribers. Become an Insider and start reading now. Have an account? Log in . Height varies a lot around the world. Using medical data, Insider calculated average height figures for the 25 shortest countries. Scroll down to see the nations with the shortest people on earth. A tape measure. Shutterstock Worldwide, scientists have found that there's around a 20 centimeter, or 7.8 inch, difference between the average height of a child in the tallest and shortest countries, according to the BBC . When it comes to adults, in countries like the Netherlands — ranked as the tallest on earth — the average person towers as high as 175.62cm (5 feet 7.96 inches). But at the other end of the scale, the average height is considerably lower. Insider compiled a ranking of average height data using a 2020 medical database run by NCD Risk Factor Collaboration , a project linked to Imperial Colle

messages.name: enhanced_search

messages.content:
- L = 11 (Venezuelan Declaration of Independence in 1811 → last two digits 11)
- A = 2 (TikTok brand colors excluding black and white: cyan and pink/red)
- C = 150 (Business Insider July 2023 lists Filipino women at 149.6 cm → rounds to 150)
- Equation: Lx = d/dx(Ax^2) + 4097 − C → 11x = 2A x + 4097 − 150 → 11x = 4x + 3947 → 7x = 3947 → x = 3947/7 ≈ 563.9

FINAL ANSWER: 563.9
